Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2009 07:19AM amiekae wrote: Thank you to all of you wonderful ladies who responded to my original post.  I am finding strength in my family, and in you ladies that are going through or have been through the same thing.  My boys are almost 3 and 10 months.  They are my heart and soul and my reason to meet this thing head on.  My 3 year old asked me what was wrong on the day I was diagnosed.  I simply told him mommy had a boo boo.  He looked at me as serious as could be and said "do you need me to kiss it?".  If it were only that easy.  :)
Posts.Title: 31 and just diagnosed amiekae Jodi_Smart

Posts.Content: amiekae wrote: Hello ladies - I'm scared.  I have just been diagnosed with breast cancer.  I am 31 years old and have 2 little boys.  Due to my age and family history I have to have a double mastectomy followed by chemotherapy.  Does anyone have any advice on how I can maintain a sense of normalcy through all of this for my babies sakes. amiekae Dx 3/30/2009, DCIS, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 31 and just diagnosed amiekae Jodi_Smart
